name: 01-Overview
content:
Overview

Objective:

The project aims to predict instances of "over-demand" in water supply systems by analyzing multiple contributing factors such as water abstraction levels, infrastructure characteristics, industrial requirements, and usage patterns.

By enabling early identification of over-demand risks, the solution supports:

  • Proactive interventions to prevent demand-supply imbalances.
  • Reduction in water wastage.
  • Optimization of resource allocation for sustainable water distribution.

Accurate predictions empower water authorities to make data-driven decisions, reduce operational risks, and enhance long-term resource management strategies.


Approach

1.Feature Engineering

  • Merge cleaned datasets into a comprehensive analytical framework.
  • Derive new predictive features such as:
  • Abstraction-to-demand ratios.
  • Industry-specific water usage contributions.
  • Infrastructure utilization metrics.

2.Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA)

  • Visualize demand and abstraction patterns across regions.
  • Identify correlations between industrial activity, infrastructure age, and over-demand incidents.
  • Use graphs to highlight seasonality, peaks, and anomalies.

3.Model Training

  • Train a Machine Learning model (e.g., Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, or Neural Networks) using historical water system data.
  • Input features include abstraction, industry demand, infrastructure health, and consumption behavior.
  • Target variable: Occurrence of over-demand (Yes/No).

4.Testing & Deployment

  • Validate the model on unseen test data to evaluate generalization performance.
  • Deploy the solution to predict over-demand scenarios in real time, integrating with water management dashboards.

Significance

  • Risk Mitigation: Identifies areas and time periods most prone to over-demand, reducing supply risks.
  • Sustainability: Supports long-term resource conservation and balanced water usage.
  • Decision Support: Provides predictive insights for water management authorities to prioritize interventions.
  • Efficiency Gains: Enhances operational reliability by aligning supply with actual demand forecasts.

Expected Outcomes

  • Predictive Insights: Accurate and actionable forecasts of over-demand scenarios.
  • Visualizations: Clear graphical representations showing the frequency, distribution, and key drivers of over-demand.
  • Operational Benefits:
  • Reduced water wastage.
  • Optimized allocation of water resources.
  • Improved reliability of supply systems
